Stanford Natural Language Inference ( SN.from sentence: To address this , this paper introduces the Stanford Natural Language Inference ( SNLI ) corpus , a collection of sentence pairs labeled for entailment , contradiction , and semantic independence .

570,152 sentence pairs.from sentence: At 570,152 sentence pairs , SNLI is two orders of magnitude larger than all other resources of its type .

sentences and labels.from sentence: And , in contrast to many such resources , all of its sentences and labels were written by humans in a grounded , naturalistic context .

separate validation phase.from sentence:
In a separate validation phase , we collected four additional judgments for each label for 56,941 of the examples .
Of these , 98 % of cases emerge with a threeannotator consensus , and 58 % see a unanimous consensus from all five annotators .
